description: From Middle French desmanteler, itself from des- (“dis-”), mantel (“coat”) + -er (verbal suffix).

verbs.description: dismantle (third-person singular simple present dismantles, present participle dismantling, simple past and past participle dismantled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, originally) To divest, strip of dress or covering.
(transitive) To remove fittings or furnishings from.
(transitive) To take apart; to disassemble; to take to pieces.
